oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Effect of Two Bedding Conditioners on Bacteria Counts and pH in Shavings, Digested Manure Solids and Recycled Sand Bedding
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kuechle, Brenda
Godden, Sandra
Bey, Russ
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bedding materials
exposure
environmental mastitis
bedding conditioner
pH
manure solid
recycled sand bedding
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bedding materials can be an important source of teat end exposure to environmental mastitis pathogens. Use of commercial bedding conditioners may represent one management tool to reduce bacteria counts in bedding. The objective of this study was to describe the effect of two commercial bedding conditioners on pH and environmental bacteria counts in shavings, digested manure solids and recycled sand bedding in commercial dairy herds.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2008; 223
